canDo: I can discuss health topics, give advice, and talk about healthy habits.

grammar.point: Should/shouldn't for advice, modals for obligation and recommendation

rules.title: Should/shouldn't for advice
rules.explanation: Use 'should' to give advice or recommendations. 'Shouldn't' for things to avoid.
rules.koreanTip: 'should'는 '~해야 해', 'shouldn't'는 '~하면 안 돼'라는 조언을 할 때 써요.

rules.title: Had better for strong advice/warnings
rules.explanation: 'Had better' is stronger than 'should' and implies consequences if not followed.
examples: You'd better rest if you're sick.
You'd better not eat so much sugar.
We'd better go to the hospital.
rules.koreanTip: 'had better'는 'should'보다 강한 충고예요. 안 따르면 나쁜 결과가 있을 것 같을 때 써요.

rules.title: Have to/Need to for necessity
rules.explanation: Use 'have to' and 'need to' when something is necessary.
examples: You have to drink more water.
I need to get more sleep.
You don't have to go to the gym every day.
rules.koreanTip: 'have to'와 'need to'는 '~해야 한다'는 필요성을 나타내요. 'don't have to'는 '~할 필요 없다'예요.

exercises.question: You ___ eat more vegetables. They're good for your health.
exercises.explanation: 'Should' is used to give healthy advice.
exercises.koreanTip: 건강에 좋은 조언을 할 때 'should'를 써요.

exercises.question: You ___ rest if you have a fever. Going to work could make it worse.
exercises.explanation: 'Had better' (='d better) is stronger advice with implied consequences.
exercises.koreanTip: 열이 있는데 쉬지 않으면 더 아플 수 있으니 강한 충고인 'had better'를 써요.

exercises.question: You ___ go to the gym every day. Three times a week is enough.
exercises.explanation: 'Don't have to' means it's not necessary.
exercises.koreanTip: 'don't have to'는 '~할 필요 없다'는 뜻이에요. 매일 갈 필요 없다는 의미예요.

exercises.question: Which gives the strongest advice?
exercises.explanation: 'Had better' is the strongest, implying negative consequences if not followed.

examples: Common symptoms include fever and cough.
words.koreanTip: 병의 '증상'을 나타내요. 의사에게 증상을 설명할 때 중요해요.

examples: Fruits and vegetables are very nutritious.
You should eat a nutritious breakfast.

words.meaning: not too much, not too little
examples: Moderate exercise is good for health.

words.koreanTip: 'prevent(예방하다)'의 명사형. '예방이 치료보다 낫다'는 영어로 'Prevention is better than cure'

examples: A healthy lifestyle includes regular exercise.
I need to change my lifestyle.

reading.title: Tips for a Healthier Life
reading.passage: Living a healthy life doesn't have to be complicated. Here are some simple tips to improve your health. First, you should try to get at least 7-8 hours of sleep every night. Sleep is essential for both physical and mental health. Second, you should eat a balanced diet with plenty of fruits, vegetables, and whole grains. You shouldn't skip meals, especially breakfast. Third, you need to exercise regularly. You don't have to go to the gym every day - even a 30-minute walk is beneficial. Fourth, you should drink plenty of water throughout the day. Many people are dehydrated without knowing it. Finally, you shouldn't ignore your mental health. Taking breaks, practicing mindfulness, and spending time with loved ones are all important. Remember, small changes can lead to big improvements over time.

questions.question: How many hours of sleep should you get?
questions.explanation: The passage says 'get at least 7-8 hours of sleep every night.'

questions.question: According to the passage, what is NOT necessary?
options: Going to the gym every day
questions.correctAnswer: Going to the gym every day
questions.explanation: The passage says 'You don't have to go to the gym every day.'

questions.question: What does 'dehydrated' mean?
options: Not having enough water in the body
questions.correctAnswer: Not having enough water in the body
questions.explanation: 'Dehydrated' means lacking water in the body.

listening.title: Doctor's Advice
listening.script: Good morning. What seems to be the problem? I've been feeling very tired lately, and I've been getting headaches. I see. Have you been getting enough sleep? Not really. I usually only sleep about 5 hours a night. Well, that's a problem. You should be getting at least 7-8 hours of sleep. Also, are you drinking enough water? I drink a lot of coffee, but maybe not enough water. You should cut down on coffee and drink more water. How about exercise? I don't have time to exercise. You don't have to do intense workouts, but you really should try to walk for at least 30 minutes a day. It would help with your energy levels. I'll try to do that. Also, you should take a break from screens sometimes. Looking at computers all day can cause headaches. Thank you, doctor. I'll follow your advice.

exercises.question: What are the patient's symptoms?
exercises.explanation: The patient says 'I've been feeling very tired lately, and I've been getting headaches.'

exercises.question: The doctor says the patient should cut down on ___.
exercises.explanation: The doctor says 'You should cut down on coffee and drink more water.'

template.template: If you want to be healthier, there are several things you should do. First, you should [ADVICE1]. This is important because [REASON1]. Second, you shouldn't [BAD HABIT]. Instead, you should [GOOD HABIT]. You don't have to [NOT NECESSARY], but you really need to [NECESSARY]. If you're feeling unwell, you'd better [STRONG ADVICE]. Following these tips will help you maintain a healthy lifestyle.
template.correctExample: If you want to be healthier, there are several things you should do. First, you should exercise at least three times a week. This is important because regular exercise improves both physical and mental health. Second, you shouldn't eat too much processed food. Instead, you should cook meals at home with fresh ingredients. You don't have to completely give up snacks, but you really need to choose healthier options. If you're feeling unwell, you'd better see a doctor rather than ignore the symptoms. Following these tips will help you maintain a healthy lifestyle.

koreanErrors.explanation: 'Should' is followed directly by the base verb, not 'to + verb'.
koreanErrors.tip: 'should' 뒤에는 바로 동사원형이 와요. 'to'를 넣지 마세요.

koreanErrors.correctForm: You don't have to eat breakfast. / You shouldn't skip breakfast.
koreanErrors.explanation: 'Must not' means it's forbidden. 'Don't have to' means it's not necessary.
koreanErrors.tip: 'must not'은 '절대 ~하면 안 된다', 'don't have to'는 '~할 필요 없다'예요. 혼동하지 마세요!

koreanErrors.errorExample: You had better to see a doctor.
koreanErrors.correctForm: You had better see a doctor.
koreanErrors.explanation: 'Had better' is followed directly by the base verb, not 'to + verb'.
koreanErrors.tip: 'had better' 뒤에도 동사원형이 바로 와요. 'to'가 필요 없어요.
